skill.name: implement-design
skill.description: Translates Figma designs into production-ready code with 1:1 visual fidelity. Use when implementing UI from Figma files, when user mentions "implement design", "generate code", "implement component", "build Figma design", provides Figma URLs, or asks to build components matching Figma specs. Requires Figma MCP server connection.

security_audit.summary: Security analysis confirms this is a legitimate Figma design-to-code implementation skill. Static findings for 'external_commands' and 'network' are false positives - the skill documents MCP tool names (not shell commands) and uses example Figma URLs that users provide. No actual security risks identified.

high_findings.title: False Positive: External Commands Detection
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged 'external_commands' at lines containing MCP tool names like `get_design_context`. These are Figma MCP server tool identifiers, not shell commands. No shell execution occurs.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: The skill documents MCP tool calls (e.g., run get_design_context), not shell commands. No backtick shell execution exists in this skill.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Network Detection
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged hardcoded URLs which are actually example Figma URLs provided by users and official documentation links. No unauthorized data exfiltration occurs.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: URLs in the skill are example URLs users would provide and Figma documentation links. No network calls are made to external servers beyond the Figma API.

content.value_statement: Translating Figma designs to code requires understanding design context, extracting design tokens, and mapping to project components. This skill provides a structured workflow for pixel-perfect design implementation using the Figma MCP server.
actual_capabilities: Parse Figma URLs to extract file keys and node IDs for design access
Fetch design context including layout, typography, colors, and component structure
Capture visual references via screenshots for validation
Translate Figma designs to project-specific code following design system patterns
Validate implemented UI against Figma designs for 1:1 visual parity
Integrate new components with existing design systems
limitations: Requires Figma MCP server to be connected and authenticated
Cannot access private Figma files without proper user authorization
Complex designs may require multiple API calls to fetch all context
Does not generate full applications - focuses on individual components or views

use_cases.title: Frontend Developer Implements UI Components
use_cases.description: A frontend developer needs to implement a button component from a Figma design file. They provide the Figma URL and the skill parses it, fetches the design context, and generates the component code.
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers building UI from design files

use_cases.title: Design System Engineer Extends Components
use_cases.description: A design system engineer wants to add a new variant to an existing button component based on Figma specs. The skill helps extract the new design tokens and integrates with the project design system.
use_cases.target_user: Design system engineers maintaining component libraries

use_cases.title: Full-Stack Developer Builds Dashboard
use_cases.description: A full-stack developer needs to quickly build a dashboard layout from a Figma mockup. The skill fetches all sections, guides implementation of each part, and validates the final result.
use_cases.target_user: Full-stack developers needing rapid UI implementation

prompt_templates.title: Basic Component Implementation
prompt_templates.scenario: User provides a simple Figma URL for a single component

prompt_templates.title: Full Page Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Build this page from Figma: https://figma.com/design/[fileKey]/[fileName]?node-id=[nodeId]. Include all sections and make it responsive.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants a complete page layout implemented

prompt_templates.title: Design System Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement this component from Figma: https://figma.com/design/[fileKey]/[fileName]?node-id=[nodeId]. Use our project design system components and map Figma tokens to our tokens.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to integrate with existing design system

prompt_templates.title: Component with Variants
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement this Figma component with all variants: https://figma.com/design/[fileKey]/[fileName]?node-id=[nodeId]. Include hover, active, disabled, and loading states.
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs a component with multiple interactive states

output_examples.output: Button component with primary variant, hover state, and loading spinner. Uses project design tokens (primary-500, primary-hover) with proper padding (12px 24px), border-radius (8px), and typography (14px, semibold).
Complete dashboard with header (64px height), sidebar (240px width), main content area with grid layout, and responsive breakpoints. Each section uses existing project components.

best_practices: Always fetch design context and screenshot before starting implementation
Map Figma design tokens to project tokens rather than using raw values
Validate against the Figma screenshot frequently during implementation
anti_patterns: Implementing without fetching design context first
Using hardcoded values instead of extracting design tokens
Creating new components when existing ones can be extended

faq.question: What is the Figma MCP server?
faq.answer: The Figma MCP server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides tools to interact with the Figma API. It allows AI assistants to fetch design context, screenshots, and assets from Figma files.

faq.question: Do I need a Figma account to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you need a Figma account with access to the Figma files you want to implement. The Figma MCP server requires authentication to fetch design data.

faq.question: Can this skill implement entire applications?
faq.answer: No, this skill focuses on implementing individual components or page sections. Complex applications require multiple implementation requests broken down by component or view.

faq.question: How does the skill handle design system integration?
faq.answer: The skill maps Figma design tokens to project design tokens and reuses existing components from the project design system when possible rather than creating new ones.

faq.question: What if my Figma design is too complex?
faq.answer: For complex designs, use the get_metadata tool first to understand the node structure, then fetch specific child nodes individually instead of the entire design at once.

faq.question: Can I use this with any framework?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill translates Figma output to your project's specific framework, styles, and conventions. It works with React, Vue, Angular, or any other framework.
